title: REDCap API endpoints
text: important arguably record endpoint, allows download actual data.
code: redcap_export_tbl(token, url, "record")

title: REDCap API endpoints
text: Without data dictionary, ’s often difficult tell variable . one three pieces metadata downloaded default redcap_export_meta function. data dictionary also really important functions format label variables (e.g. redcap_prep, singlechoice_ops, singlechoice_factor co)
code: redcap_export_tbl(token, url, "metadata") redcap_export_meta(token, url)$metadata

title: REDCap API endpoints
text: list eCRFs (known instruments REDCap). provides link data dictionary instrument labels seen REDCap.
code: redcap_export_tbl(token, url, "instrument")

title: REDCap API endpoints
text: list events (visits) one three pieces metadata downloaded redcap_export_meta function.
code: redcap_export_tbl(token, url, "event") redcap_export_meta(token, url)$event

title: REDCap API endpoints
text: endpoint lists forms available events/visits. one three pieces metadata downloaded redcap_export_meta function.
code: redcap_export_tbl(token, url, "formEventMapping") redcap_export_meta(token, url)$formEventMapping

title: REDCap API endpoints
text: use repeated forms /events used.
code: redcap_export_tbl(token, url, "repeatingFormsEvents")

title: REDCap API endpoints
text: Arms allow different groups participants (records) different visit structures. export, visible redcap_event_name variable e.g. form_name_arm_1. arm API endpoint allows one retrieve labels arms.
code: redcap_export_tbl(token, url, "arm")

what: Export List of Export Field Names
title: REDCap API endpoints
text: endpoint lists variable names exported REDCap. matches data dictionary, except case multiple choice variables exported x_1, x_2, etc.
code: redcap_export_tbl(token, url, "exportFieldNames")

title: redcaptools
text: REDCap exports generally come single files, repeating elements new rows, lots empty variables (e.g. don’t exist given visit). use data, must often subsetted form event, variables selected, etc. redcaptools eases exporting data form beginning redcap_export_byform function. export functions redcap_export_meta (downloading various metadata objects - currently data dictionary, form-event-mapping event tables) redcap_export_tbl, can used use whatever parameters like API (see REDCap documentation details). dataset REDCap exports website interface accessed instance via:
code: token <- "my-redcap-token" url <- "https://redcap.mydomain.com/api/"  data <- redcap_export_byform(token, url) record <- redcap_export_tbl(token, url, "record")

title: redcaptools
text: REDCap also allows exporting data manually web interface. redcaptools primarily intended used API, much also work manually exported datasets. Important note data dictionary must provided manually case. example, redcap_toform function tries split manually downloaded dataset ’s constituent forms. less information available, ’s robust API version, may still useful.
code: # a small manually downloaded testing dataset data <- readRDS(system.file("extdata/test.rda", package = "redcaptools")) # the data dictionary dd <- read.csv(system.file("extdata/DataDictionary.csv", package = "redcaptools"))  formdata <- redcap_toform(data, dd)

title: redcaptools
text: make data usable R, ’s often nice label data, create factor, convert dates etc. redcaptools functions help . following functions also label variables. redcap_prep function easiest use. wraps functions following section.
code: meta <- redcap_export_meta(token, url) # could also use a data dictionary exported manually  # where all data is in a single dataframe prepped <- redcap_prep(record, meta$metadata)  # for data split by forms, use sapply prepped <- sapply(data, redcap_prep, metadata = meta$metadata)

title: redcaptools
text: REDCap single multiple choice factor type variables. need handling separately, two sets functions. Lists options can obtained singlechoice_opts multichoice_opts functions. rather information. Factors can created easily
code: singlechoice_opts(meta$metadata) mutlichoice_opts(meta$metadata) prepped <- sapply(data, singlechoice_factor, metadata = meta$metadata) prepped <- sapply(prepped, multichoice_factor, metadata = meta$metadata)

title: redcaptools
text: single multiple choice variables, Date POSIX variables also need handling separately.
code: prepped <- sapply(prepped, redcap_prep_dates, metadata = meta$metadata) prepped <- sapply(prepped, redcap_prep_datetimes, metadata = meta$metadata)

title: Authors and Citation
text: Alan G. Haynes. Maintainer. Dominik Güntensperger. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Güntensperger D (2024). redcaptools: Tools exporting working REDCap data. R package version 0.4.0.
code: @Manual{,   title = {redcaptools: Tools for exporting and working with REDCap data},   author = {Dominik Güntensperger},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.4.0}, }

what: Tools for exporting and working with REDCap data
title: Tools for exporting and working with REDCap data
text: redcaptools contains home-grown functions working REDCap data R.

title: Tools for exporting and working with REDCap data
text: can install development version redcaptools github : CTU Bern’s package universe
code: remotes::install_github("CTU-Bern/redcaptools") install.packages("redcaptools", repos = c('https://ctu-bern.r-universe.dev', 'https://cloud.r-project.org'))

title: Tools for exporting and working with REDCap data
text: REDCap offers (least) two approaches exporting projects data - throught web interface via clicking buttons, API, allows programmatic access lot information available web interface. order use API, token required. API token can requested projects API page, accessible link applications section menu left side page.  see link, consult whoever charge user management project give access . access, can request token, system administrator must approve. approved, token shown API page. Now everything download data API. token essentially username, password reference specific project, extra care must taken . httr package vignette managing secrets, relevant API token. standard download can replicated via interesting redcap_export_byform function, returns list dataframes, element list specific eCRF database. available metadata stored REDCap available via redcap_export_meta function, including data dictionary, can also downloaded via website. data metadata, redcap_prep function can used reformat data - convert variables date, POSIX, factors, etc appropriate.
code: # the URL ir the same as the website just with '/api/' on the end url <- "https://redcap.domain.something/api/" token <- readLines("path-to-file-containing-token") # or some other method d <- redcap_export_tbl(token, url, "record") l <- redcap_export_byform(token, url) m <- redcap_export_meta(token, url) prepped <- redcap_prep(d, m$metadata) prepped_list <- sapply(l, redcap_prep, metadata = m$metadata)

what: Get options for single and multi choice questions — singlechoice_opts
title: Get options for single and multi choice questions — singlechoice_opts
text: Get options single multi choice questions

title: Get options for single and multi choice questions — singlechoice_opts
code: singlechoice_opts(metadata)  multichoice_opts(metadata)

title: Get options for single and multi choice questions — singlechoice_opts
text: metadata data.frame containing metadata

title: Get options for single and multi choice questions — singlechoice_opts
text: data.frame variables var (variable), label (variable label), vals (possible values variable) labs (labels related value vals) data.frame variables ovar (variable appears data dictionary/metadata), var (variable appears data ), vlabel (variable label), vals (possible values variable) labs (labels related value vals)

title: Get options for single and multi choice questions — singlechoice_opts
text: Multiple choice variables exist REDCap data set 0/1/TRUE/FALSE variables, 1/TRUE represents selected/checked answer. Hence, single multiple choice 'question' datadictionary/metadata n options, n variables. variable variable name (e.g. morbidities) followed 3 underscores (___) option number (e.g. 1) - morbidities___1.

title: Convert variables to logical — convert_to_logical
text: particularly useful binary variables encoded e.g. Yes options. Variable labels retained, may may make sense, depending variable

title: Convert variables to logical — convert_to_logical
code: convert_to_logical(   data,   vars,   true = "Yes",   replace = TRUE,   append = "_logical" )

title: Convert variables to logical — convert_to_logical
text: data dataframe vars character string variables convert true value become TRUE replace Replace indicated variables append text append new variables (replace = TRUE)

title: Convert variables to logical — convert_to_logical
text: data modified variables, potentially additional variables (replace = TRUE)

title: Example import data — importdemo_data
text: Simulated import data common REDCap field types validations used data dictionary importdemo_dict testing redcap_import_select redcap_import_recode. Item names coding show mismatches purpose interactive functions can tested.

title: REDCap Date Conversion — redcap_dates
text: function used prepare date fields data table import REDCap. function tries take ()possibilities enter dates account converts .Date format.

title: REDCap Date Conversion — redcap_dates
code: redcap_dates(var, unk_day = "01", unk_month = "01", unk_cent = "20")

title: REDCap Date Conversion — redcap_dates
text: var variable convert unk_day Day use unknown, .e. year month + year found. default 01 (2022 -> 2022-01-01). unk_month Month use unknown, .e. year found. default 01 (2022 -> 2022-01-01). unk_cent Century use unknown, .e. year found. default 20 (22 -> 2022)

title: REDCap Date Conversion — redcap_dates
text: converted variable

title: REDCap Date Conversion — redcap_dates
code: var <-c("01.12.2022", "12.2022", "2022", "01/12/2022") redcap_dates(var) #> Warning: This conversion is (currently) only valid with the european date format (days before months) and will lead to wrong results otherwise!! #>  #> [1] "2022-12-01" "2022-12-01" "2022-01-01" "2022-12-01"

title: Export data in batches — redcap_export_batch
text: Exports large databases may fail using standard export methods implemented redcap_export_tbl redcap_export_byform. remedy , redcap_export_batch function exports data smaller chunks (1000 records default)

title: Export data in batches — redcap_export_batch
code: redcap_export_batch(   token,   url,   batchsize = 1000,   meta = NULL,   byform = FALSE,   remove_empty = TRUE,   ... )

title: Export data in batches — redcap_export_batch
text: token REDcap API token url address API batchsize number records per batch meta metadata redcap_export_meta (downloaded provided) byform logical. Download data form (see redcap_export_byform) remove_empty using byform: empty rows removed dataset (REDCap automatically creates forms event form event created) ... parameters passed API (see REDCap API documentation options)

title: Export data in batches — redcap_export_batch
text: depending byform, either list dataframes single dataframe

title: Export data in batches — redcap_export_batch
code: # token <- "some_really_long_string_provided_by_REDCap" # as a single dataframe # redcap_export_batch(token, "https://www.some_redcap_url.com/api/") # as a list of dataframes (forms) # redcap_export_batch(token, "https://www.some_redcap_url.com/api/", byform = TRUE)

what: Export the most important REDCap metadata tables — redcap_export_meta

text: REDCap API large number API endpoints. metadata-type details listed page.

title: Export the most important REDCap metadata tables — redcap_export_meta
code: redcap_export_meta(   token,   url,   tabs = c("metadata", "event", "formEventMapping", "instrument"),   ... )

title: Export the most important REDCap metadata tables — redcap_export_meta
text: token REDcap API token url address API tabs tables export. project always added. ... parameters passed API (see REDCap API documentation options)

title: Export the most important REDCap metadata tables — redcap_export_meta
text: list dataframes

title: Export the most important REDCap metadata tables — redcap_export_meta
text: Allowed tabs arm - labels projects arms dag - data access groups (DAGs) userDagMapping - mapping users DAGs event - list events project (available longitudinal projects) exportFieldNames - list fields API returns instrument - list instruments (eCRFs/forms) project formEventMapping - mapping instruments (forms) events (available longitudinal projects) metadata - data dictionary project - information project record - data . method many options. See API help page REDCap instance repeatingFormsEvents - forms can repeat events report - access custom reports defined REDCap version - REDCap version user - list users userRole - rights role userRoleMapping - user-roll mapping

title: Export the most important REDCap metadata tables — redcap_export_meta
text: tables relevant non-longitudinal projects (e.g. formEventMapping event) silently removed

title: REDCap Recode — redcap_import_recode
text: function loops variable classes data set lets user compare variable types set REDCap. API token needed download variable names REDCap. class/type can changed output new summary match REDCap. 'factor' chosen class, script loops factor levels compares coding defined REDCap. factor levels can matched respective codes REDCap. function returns data frame recoded variables writes executed code log-file copy-pasting adjusting/reusing.

title: REDCap Recode — redcap_import_recode
code: redcap_import_recode(selected_data, dict = NULL, rc_token, rc_url)

title: REDCap Recode — redcap_import_recode
text: selected_data Data recoded dict Data dictionary (e.g. downloaded REDCap via redcap_export_meta(rc_token, rc_url)$meta). supplied, downloaded API using rc_token. rc_token REDCap API token rc_url Link REDCap API. Default: https://redcap.ctu.unibe.ch/api/

title: REDCap Recode — redcap_import_recode
text: Data frame recoded data. Log-file executed code.

title: REDCap Recode — redcap_import_recode
code: # data(importdemo_data) # data(importdemo_dict) # redcap_import_recode(importdemo_data, importdemo_dict)  # if using local data: # token <- "xxxxx" # url <- "xxxxx" # file <- "data.csv" # redcap_import_recode(file, rc_token = token, rc_url = url)

title: REDCap Select and Rename — redcap_import_select
text: function loops variable names data set lets user compare variable names set REDCap.  REDCap data dictionary can either directly provided downloaded REDCap project providing API token matching URL.  variables matching names REDCap, user can decide automatically select without renaming. auto-selecting turned , user can decide select variables select rename .  variables without matching names REDCap, user always prompted decide either select variables select rename .  function returns data frame selected/renamed variables, writes overview csv-table, short summary executed code log-file copy-pasting adjusting/reusing.

title: REDCap Select and Rename — redcap_import_select
code: redcap_import_select(   import_data,   dict = NULL,   rc_token,   rc_url,   forms = NULL,   auto_match = TRUE,   auto_skip_nomatch = FALSE,   skip_intro = FALSE,   suppress_txt = FALSE,   log = TRUE,   log_code = "redcap_import_select_code.txt",   log_table = "redcap_import_select_overview.txt",   wait = 2 )

title: REDCap Select and Rename — redcap_import_select
text: import_data Data frame imported dict Data dictionary (e.g. downloaded REDCap via redcap_export_meta(rc_token, rc_url)$meta). supplied, downloaded API using rc_token rc_url. rc_token REDCap API token rc_url Link REDCap API forms Character vector forms set REDCap variable names displayed. Default = forms. auto_match TRUE, variables matching names automatically selected. FALSE, user can decide variable shall imported . Default = TRUE. auto_skip_nomatch TRUE, variables without matching names automatically skipped. FALSE, user can decide select rename variable. Default = FALSE. skip_intro set TRUE, introduction messages skipped. Default = FALSE suppress_txt set TRUE, text output suppressed (recommended). Default = FALSE. log TRUE, overview csv-table, log-file stored working directory. Default = TRUE. log_code Name location log-file containing executed code. Default = redcap_import_select_code.txt. log_table Name location csv.table containing tabular overview. Default = redcap_import_select_overview.csv. wait Allows set latency time steps. Default = 2s.

title: REDCap Select and Rename — redcap_import_select
text: Data frame selected/renamed data. Log-file executed code.  CSV-table overview.

title: REDCap Select and Rename — redcap_import_select
code: # data(importdemo_data) # data(importdemo_dict) # redcap_import_select(importdemo_data, importdemo_dict)  # if using local data: # token <- "xxxxx" # url <- "xxxxx" # file <- "data.csv" # redcap_import_select(file, rc_token = token, rc_url = url)

what: Convert manually downloaded REDCap data into a list of forms — redcap_toform
title: Convert manually downloaded REDCap data into a list of forms — redcap_toform
text: Similar redcap_export_byform, function tries split manually downloaded dataset constituent forms. use API allows individual forms downloaded, manual download, data dictionary available auxillary information. data dictionary available, function use variable names guess forms (see details).

title: Convert manually downloaded REDCap data into a list of forms — redcap_toform
code: redcap_toform(data, datadict = NULL, metadata = NULL, guess_events = TRUE, ...)

title: Convert manually downloaded REDCap data into a list of forms — redcap_toform
text: data imported REDCap data datadict data dictionary downloaded manually REDCap metadata metadata downloaded REDCap API guess_events restrict forms events (rows) data exists (see details) ... additional arguments passed functions (currently unused)

title: Convert manually downloaded REDCap data into a list of forms — redcap_toform
text: longitudinal data collection many forms, REDCap dataset large degree empty cells. guess_events argument uses missingness indicator row part form question. user variables (.e. start redcap) empty, row removed dataset. neither datadict metadata provided, function attempt guess forms based variable names, specifically form_complete variables denote state form. foolproof method: may variables data end _complete.

title: Convert manually downloaded REDCap data into a list of forms — redcap_toform
code: data <- readRDS(system.file("extdata/test.rda", package = "redcaptools")) metadata <- readRDS(system.file("extdata/meta.rda", package = "redcaptools")) dd <- read.csv(system.file("extdata/DataDictionary.csv", package = "redcaptools")) redcap_toform(data, dd) #> $form1 #>   record_id redcap_event_name redcap_repeat_instrument redcap_repeat_instance #> 1 1         1     event_1_arm_1                                              NA #> 2         2       first_arm_2                                              NA #>     datevar2   datevar3 yesnovar2 #> 1 2022-09-04 2022-09-01         0 #> 2 2022-09-13 2022-09-02         0 #>  #> $form3 #>   record_id redcap_event_name redcap_repeat_instrument redcap_repeat_instance #> 1         1     event_1_arm_1 1 2022-09-02    654       3 #> 2 2022-09-05     69       2 #> 3 2022-09-14     89       1 #> 4 2022-09-30     78       3 #> 5 2022-08-01     66       1 #>  redcap_toform(data, metadata = metadata) #> title: redcaptools 0.4.0
text: rc_prep now redcap_prep rc_dates now redcap_prep_dates rc_datetimes now redcap_prep_datetimes improved support single multiple choice variables exist database addition redcap_toform splits dataframe list dataframes, one form. addition new vignette covering details API endpoints offered REDCap.

title: redcaptools 0.3.2
text: finalizing redcap_import_select user-friendly introduction, automated options tests new function redcap_import_recode

title: redcaptools 0.3.1
text: bugfix redcap_export_batch: caused error detected variable types batches differed.

title: redcaptools 0.3.0
text: addition redcap_select_rename: user-guided loop select rename variables REDCap import. addition redcap_recode: user-guided loop reformat recode variables REDCap import.

title: redcaptools 0.2.8
text: export additional dataprep helpers (see #15)

title: redcaptools 0.2.7
text: addition redcap_export_batch times data gets big export methods. can used return either single dataframe (per redcap_export_tbl) list forms (per redcap_export_byform).

title: redcaptools 0.2.6
text: redcap_export_byform now allows exporting simple non-longitudinal projects testing addition convert_to_logical converting binary (e.g. variables coded ‘Yes’ ‘’) variables logical

title: redcaptools 0.2.5
text: option include variable label well option label multiple choice variables use separator testing

title: redcaptools 0.2.4
text: add tests support different primary key (normally record_id)

title: redcaptools 0.2.3
text: specify version httr2 required

title: redcaptools 0.2.2
text: better support forms - removes empty rows API export support splitting manually exporting exports forms split_by_form rc_prep added options replacing variable types text append (replacing) improve vignette

title: redcaptools 0.2.1
text: add support yesno variables

title: redcaptools 0.2.0
text: Functions labelling converting factors dates

title: redcaptools 0.1.0
text: Added NEWS.md file track changes package.
